scatter_reg¶

vizcovidfr.regression.regression.scatter_reg(num_var, num_reg, save=False)¶

Display the scatter plot of the evolution of the given variable in the given region. Each variable and region have a special code that you can see in function parameters for details.

Parameters

  • num_var (int) – code of the variable you want to display. Codes are in the following dictionary.

  • num_reg (int) – code of the region you want to display. Codes are the official INSAA code region and are given in the dictionary below.

  • save (bool, optional, default = False) – True if you want to save the graph in pdf file, False otherwise.

Variable dictionary :

1 : Hospitalization

2 : Reanimation

3 : Conventional hospitalization

4 : SSR and USLD

5 : Others

6 : Come back home

7 : Deaths

  • Hospitalization :

    number of hospitalized patients.

  • Reanimation :

    number of people currently in intensive care.

  • Conventional hospitalization :

    number of people currently in conventional hospitalization.

  • SSR and USLD :

    number of people currently in Aftercare and Rehabilitation (SSR in french) or Long-Term Care Units (USLD in french).

  • Others :

    number of people currently hospitalized in another type of service.

  • Come back home :

    cumulative number of people who returned home.

  • Deaths :

    cumulative number of deceased persons.

Region dictionary :

1 : Guadeloupe

2 : Martinique

3 : Guyane

4 : La Reunion

6 : Mayotte

11 : Île-de-France

24 : Centre-Val de Loire

27 : Bourgogne-Franche-Comte

28 : Normandie

32 : Hauts-de-France

44 : Grand Est

52 : Pays de la Loire

53 : Bretagne

75 : Nouvelle-Aquitaine

76 : Occitanie

84 : Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes

93 : Provence-Alpes Côte d’Azur

94 : Corse

Returns

Scatter plot of one of the Covid variable in a specific region of France.

Return type

Figure

Example

Scatter plot of hospitalization in Île-de-France

>>> scatter_reg(1,11)

poly_fit¶

vizcovidfr.regression.regression.poly_fit(num_var, num_reg, save=False)¶

Display the scatter plot of the evolution of the given variable in the given region with a polynomial regression. Each variable and region have a special code that you can see in function parameters for details. Degree of polynom is chosen by minimizing the mean squared error and is displayed as well.

Parameters

  • num_var (int) – code of the variable you want to display. Codes are in the following dictionary.

  • num_reg (int) – code of the region you want to display. Codes are the official INSAA code region and are given in the dictionary below.

  • save (bool, optional, default=False) – True if you want to save the graph in pdf file, False otherwise.

Variable dictionary :

1 : Hospitalization

2 : Reanimation

3 : Conventional hospitalization

4 : SSR and USLD

5 : Others

6 : Come back home

7 : Deaths

  • Hospitalization :

    number of hospitalized patients.

  • Reanimation :

    number of people currently in intensive care.

  • Conventional hospitalization :

    number of people currently in conventional hospitalization.

  • SSR and USLD :

    number of people currently in Aftercare and Rehabilitation (SSR in french) or Long-Term Care Units (USLD in french).

  • Others :

    number of people currently hospitalized in another type of service.

  • Come back home :

    cumulative number of people who returned home.

  • Deaths :

    cumulative number of deceased persons.

Region dictionary :

1 : Guadeloupe

2 : Martinique

3 : Guyane

4 : La Reunion

6 : Mayotte

11 : Île-de-France

24 : Centre-Val de Loire

27 : Bourgogne-Franche-Comte

28 : Normandie

32 : Hauts-de-France

44 : Grand Est

52 : Pays de la Loire

53 : Bretagne

75 : Nouvelle-Aquitaine

76 : Occitanie

84 : Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes

93 : Provence-Alpes Côte d’Azur

94 : Corse

Returns

Scatter plot of one of the Covid variable in a specific region of France with the regression curve.

Return type

Figure

Example

Polynomial regression of hospitalization in Île-de-France

>>> poly_fit(1,11)

Polynomial regression of hospitalization in Provence

>>> poly_fit(1,93)

R2¶

vizcovidfr.regression.regression.R2(num_var, num_reg)¶

Display the R2 of the polynomial regression made by poly_fit function.

Parameters

  • num_var (int) – code of the variable you want to display. Codes are in the following dictionary.

  • num_reg (int) – code of the region you want to display. Codes are the official INSAA code region and are given in the dictionary below.

Variable dictionary :

1 : Hospitalization

2 : Reanimation

3 : Conventional hospitalization

4 : SSR and USLD

5 : Others

6 : Come back home

7 : Deaths

  • Hospitalization :

    number of hospitalized patients.

  • Reanimation :

    number of people currently in intensive care.

  • Conventional hospitalization :

    number of people currently in conventional hospitalization.

  • SSR and USLD :

    number of people currently in Aftercare and Rehabilitation (SSR in french) or Long-Term Care Units (USLD in french).

  • Others :

    number of people currently hospitalized in another type of service.

  • Come back home :

    cumulative number of people who returned home.

  • Deaths :

    cumulative number of deceased persons.

Region dictionary :

1 : Guadeloupe

2 : Martinique

3 : Guyane

4 : La Reunion

6 : Mayotte

11 : Île-de-France

24 : Centre-Val de Loire

27 : Bourgogne-Franche-Comte

28 : Normandie

32 : Hauts-de-France

44 : Grand Est

52 : Pays de la Loire

53 : Bretagne

75 : Nouvelle-Aquitaine

76 : Occitanie

84 : Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes

93 : Provence-Alpes Côte d’Azur

94 : Corse

Returns

R2 of the polynomial regression of one of the Covid variable in a specific region of France.

Return type

float

Example

R2 of polynomial regression of hospitalization in Île-de-France

>>> R2(1,11)
